alert.note: Alert for Alexander (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 08 at 8:29PM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Alexander, central Fulton, western Carlisle, northwestern Hickman, southwestern Ballard, Mississippi and northeastern New Madrid Counties through 900 PM CST... At 829 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Charleston to 7 miles east of Hunter-Dawson State Historic Site. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Charleston and Wyatt around 835 PM CST. Cairo around 840 PM CST. Hickman, Wickliffe and Towosahgy State Historic Site around 845 PM CST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Barlow and La Center. This includes Interstate 57 in Missouri between Mile Markers 6 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
